dmca.title: [ABUSE] Probable DMCA violation
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Thursday, December 15, 2005 8:41 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Cc: Policy Enforcement
Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] Probable DMCA violation


For your review.

Martin Gaston
Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/

Begin forwarded message:

> From: Mike McFarland <mike@narcolept.com>
> Date: December 14, 2005 10:39:34 PM CST
> To: abuse@theplanet.com,  abuse@northrex.com,  abuse@enom.com
> Subject: [ABUSE] Probable DMCA violation
> X-Spam-Level: ---------------------------------------------------
> X-Spam-Level: ---------------------------------------------------
>
> abuse@theplanet.com - you are hosting this server abuse@northrex.com - 
> you are providing dns, and probably hosting this on a shared server 
> through theplanet/servermatrix
> abuse@enom.com   - you hold registration for this domain
>
> I'm writing to inform you of copyrighted mp3s on your network, at:
>
> http://www.westroo.com/blah/
>
> This is more than likely a DMCA violation, and I'm sure the copyright 
> holders would not be too happy to discover this. Please remove the 
> account in question, as piracy is bad.
>
